summary:
Ancient Carthage was a powerful civilization in North Africa, founded by the Phoenicians around 814 BC. It grew from a small settlement to a huge empire, ruling over parts of Africa, Spain, and the Mediterranean islands. Carthage became one of the richest and largest cities in the ancient world, trading with places as far as Asia and Europe.

They had a strong navy and an army with soldiers from many different lands. Carthage fought many wars, especially with the Greeks and Romans. After the Punic Wars, the Romans destroyed Carthage in 146 BC but later rebuilt it. Carthage's culture was unique, blending Phoenician and local traditions.
title: Ancient Carthage
